shloka.text: ॐ शुक्लाम्बरधरं विष्णुं शशिवर्णं चथुर्भुजम् । प्रसन्नवदनं ध्यायेत् सर्वविघ्नोपशान्त्ये ॥१॥
shloka.explanation: For the eradication of all obstructions, I meditate ("dhyayeth") on Vishnu, who is wearing ("dharam") a white ("shukla") cloth ("ambara"), who is of the color ("varnam") of the moon ("sashi"), who has four ("chatur") arms ("bhujam"), and who has a placid expression ("prasanna") on His face ("vadanam").

shloka.text: यस्य द्विरदवत्राध्या: पारिष्ध्या: पर: श्तम्। विध्नं निघ्नन्ति सततं विष्वकसेनं तमाश्र् ये ॥२॥
shloka.explanation: The elephant faced one along with his innumerable attendants, Would always remove obstacles as we depend on Vishvaksena.
